data.title: Pub type food on the Square in Marietta.
data.text: Hemingways is conveniently located in Marietta Square- close to the park and close to the theaters. In nice weather there is a great outside seating area. Sandwiches, fries, wonderful desserts, and more. Very pleasant and generally quick service.

data.title: Best bat In Marietta!!!
data.text: A must to visit for some good food and excellent drinks.  Multiple televisions all over the place and great decor

data.title: Best fried pickles ever!!
data.text: Before my boyfriend took me to Hemingways I had never had fried pickles. Once I tried them I was hooked! Now when I try them everywhere else...I get sad lol no one serves the spears and no one flavors them like Hemingways. My boyfriend swears by the Maui Maui and judges everyone's else's against theirs as well!! Very nice atmosphere and now our anniversary date night 😍

data.title: Lunch
data.text:
Picked this as it had tables free outside on a busy Saturday.

The French dip impressed my husband but I have to say the sloppy joe was disappointing.

Service was quick and friendly.

data.title: It's bar food people!
data.text: If your looking for a staple, in the community and a hang out, this is your place.  It's bar food and cocktails.  Check with your server for the "what's happening".  Could run in to some live music and a lot of local's.  If you do not know the difination of bar food, do not go here!  Time to get down and dirty!  We love it.  It is, what it is!

data.title: 👎🏻
data.text: I have finally eaten at every restaurant on the square and the very last one Hemingways was a complete let down.  The calamari had no flavor even with the sauce.  The chili cheese burger was a joke.  The only thing that was half way decent was the plantains, but honestly how hard is it to get plantains right.  My wife's salad looked like it was something out of a box from the local Kroger.  This place was a complete let down.  Save your money and go eat at Tsunami, Shillings or even Sugar Cakes

data.title: Not the best choice on the square
data.text: My husband got dinner from here while I got from another restaurant. He wished that he had gotten from when I did. His dinner was "nothing special"

data.title: Okay, but won't return
data.text:
The best part of our meal was the fried pickles; the rest was just mediocre. I had a Reuben which was so greasy,  I had to eat it with a fork and knife, (which were plastic,  btw).
We sat outside,  and the plastic plates and utensils kept trying to fly away. While we were eating,  we noticed the Information Center was just behind us; we visited there after eating and quickly realized that it should have been our first stop. They gave us eating recommendations that didn't include Hemingways. 
Also, the bathrooms are located downstairs in the bowels of the building - - VERY WEIRD!

data.title: Great Service and Atmosphere
data.text: Walked into a little piece of Key West as I was greeted promptly by Andi and she was super accommodating. Dave the owner came up and asked how everything was which is refreshing now a days. I had the Burger and it was phenomenal. Overall , if your causing the square stop on in and get treated like a king!

data.title: If you want it out of the box freezer you have found your spot
data.text: Mac and cheese was looked surprising like Kraft and the chicken finger looked like Tyson and everything else was ver under whelming. Find someplace else

data.title: Just okay
data.text: Popped in to get out of the rain.  Ordered nachos, a Guinness, and a juice box for $20.  Surprised to see Guinness served in a plastic cup.  Nachos were okay. Nachos served on thin chips that went soggy fast.  All serving-ware was plastic and just seemed cheap for its location and pricing.  Our server was friendly and efficient but we likely won't return when there are so many other options.

data.title: Never Again
data.text:
Came here for a late dinner while out at the Marietta Arts festival. Was seated and ordered when I noticed the table next to me who came in afterwards was served and eating even before my appetizer had arrived. Then when the lettuce with a dried out piece of salmon arrives 20 minutes later, I was even more disappointed. 
With hubby ordering a burger how can you mess up a salmon salad (lettuce a cucumber wedge, and count them, 2 cherry tomatoes) and a reheated frozen "crab" cake that was supposed to be the appetizer all served on a styrofoam plate with plastic utensils and a waitress who obviously forgot to put in this order on time all for $30! 

Hmmm🤔 Wow😟
And never again 😠

data.title: What a nice change!
data.text: I reviewed Hemingway's a few years ago, and was disappointed because the restaurant was so smoky from cigarette smokers. Now the restaurant is smoke-free! You can actually enjoy your food, you can sit out on the patio and it's quite a nice place.

data.title: Just okay
data.text: Came for casual dinner with party of 9, that seemed to overwhelm them a bit. Got a variety of menu items between us. I got the southwest chicken salad, which was a tad on the small side as half the plate was full of tortilla chips. Was tasty but too small. Didn't really want a plateful of chips. Overall just average bar food. Nothing special considering the number of choices in the square.

data.title: Good fish sandwich!
data.text: Service was very good and liked the Key West atmosphere. I had the Mahi-Mahi Sandwich fried, which was excellent. I would return again.

data.title: Stay away!
data.text: Excellent entertainment but very bad food and drinks.  Better load up on drinks and have dinner before going there.  Yet,  entertainment is phenomenal.

data.title: Passing through
data.text: Probably would not have gone there if I had read the reviews, but my experience was not that bad. Had pleasant seats outside looking at the square. The service was good and our food was good. We only had salads and they were quite large and fresh. We where served on higher end paper plates, however I assume it was because we were on the patio. Would go back again for lunch, not sure how dinner would be.

data.title: Nice for lunch but better for evening entertainment and drinks
data.text: Good sandwiches but the nightly entertainment, craft beers and old fashioned bar are what makes this place worth a visit. They also have delicious desserts and a wonderful outside dining area. Typical pub grub

data.title: Awful Food, but Sometimes Good Entertainment
data.text: At one time many years ago, this place offered decent food and great entertainment. However the food has down downhill(a simple salad with brown lettuce!!) Many of the great musicians will no longer play here since there are other local  venues that treat them better. However occasionally they still get some good bands that are worth hearing. We just remember to eat before we go out.They do have a nice outside area and when the weather is good, it is nice to listen to some live acoustic music while sipping a drink.

data.title: Food really gone downhill, decor is shabby
data.text: I haven't been to Hemingway's in many years, and I am sorry I did. The whole place looks like a run down bar. Bare old looking tables with rickety chairs. Food comes on plastic plates with plastic utensils and draft beer in a plastic cup. For the prices they are charging - you've got to be kidding me! What a mess of a place to be on lovely Marietta Square.
